ApproxsimClient.timeline
Class TimeInterval

java.lang.Object
  ApproxsimClient.timeline.TimeInterval

public class TimeInterval
extends Object

This class is used to define time interval in the timeline.

Field Summary
static int LEFT
          Indicates that the left side of the interval is treated.
static int RIGHT
          Indicates that the right side of the interval is treated.
 
Constructor Summary
TimeInterval(long timeStep, long startTime, long endTime)
          Creates a time interval.

          Checks if an interval is contained in this one.
 boolean decreaseInterval(int indicator)
          Decreases the interval with one time step.
 long[] getAllTimes()
          Return all times this interval contains such that the difference between two consecutive times is equal to the time step.
 long[] getAllTimes(long tstart, long tend)
          Return all times in the subinterval of this interval such that the difference between two consecutive times is equal to the time step.

          Returns the end time of the interval.

Method Detail

getNrOfTimeSteps

public long getNrOfTimeSteps()
Returns number of time steps the time interval contains.

public long getNrOfTimes()
Returns number of times the time interval contains.

getAllTimes

public long[] getAllTimes()
Return all times this interval contains such that the difference between two consecutive times is equal to the time step.

getAllTimes

public long[] getAllTimes(long tstart,
                          long tend)
Return all times in the subinterval of this interval such that the difference between two consecutive times is equal to the time step.

Parameters:
tstart - start time of the subinterval.
tend - end time of the subinterval.

getStartTime

public long getStartTime()
Returns the start time of the interval.

getEndTime

public long getEndTime()
Returns the end time of the interval.

getTimeStep

public long getTimeStep()
Returns the time step of the interval.

setTimeStep

public boolean setTimeStep(long timeStep,
                           long refTime)
Sets the time step and adjusts the start and end times of the interval to the reference time.

Parameters:
timeStep - new time step.
refTime - reference time.
Returns:
true if the interval is adjusted to the new time step, false otherwise.

increaseInterval

public void increaseInterval(int indicator)
Increses the interval with one time step.

Parameters:
indicator - indicates if the interval will be increased from the left or from the right.

decreaseInterval

public boolean decreaseInterval(int indicator)
Decreases the interval with one time step.

Parameters:
indicator - indicates if the interval will be decreased from the left or from the right.

intersects

public boolean intersects(TimeInterval interval)
Checks if the two intervals intersect.

contains

public boolean contains(TimeInterval interval)
Checks if an interval is contained in this one.

add

public void add(TimeInterval interval)
Adds new time interval to this one. Obs. This method should be called only if the two intervals intersect.

remove

public TimeInterval[] remove(TimeInterval interval)
Removes a time interval from this one.
